page.title: 13 The Flood Relief Scheme
page.content: The dam is made out of clay and soil.There is a tunnel made with concrete pipes going under the dam,and just at the beginning of the pipes there is a grid which stops branches and other debris going in to the river.When the tunnel is full of water,the level will rise up the dam. Built up the side of the dam are three boxes of metal that set off an alarm at the Wessex Water Board,so they are warned if the land is in danger of flooding. The River Brue has been straightened out and directed through the dam. The flood relief scheme should stop the problem of flooding in Bruton.The River Brue has often flooded in the past.It is now working satisfactorily.
